text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with hot chocolate stones this is
kind of for the guys although you ladies
you know i love you you can try this too
i know what you're thinking hey you gave

this is so fast and easy check it out
so you're gonna take 8 ounces of a good
dark chocolate something really good I'm
using a 62% look for something that has
a percentage of chocolate on it
70s good use something nice no you can't
use milk chocolate alright we're going
to chop that up pretty small and once
it's chopped up put it in a bowl don't
eat any or this won't work I'm also
going to add a pinch about 1/8 of a
teaspoon of hot chipotle pepper all
right that's where the hot comes from in
this although it's more like warm than
hot it's not really going to be spicy so
don't worry I'm also going to add a big
pinch of salt on the stove we're going
to heat exactly 1/2 cup of heavy cream
watch it don't walk away it's going to
come to a boil in just a minute over
medium heat when it does pour it over
your chocolate and let it sit for three
minutes just stand there and look at it
in fact stand there and think of what
you're going to wear wear some nice
don't wear that sure you always wear
wear something different she doesn't
like that shirt alright after three
minutes give it a stir with your spatula
until it's completely smooth and
beautiful you'll know because it will be
smooth beautiful see because this is for
the guys really I can't have you
scooping and rolling truffles and they
that kind of stuff
so we're going to go with a nice stone
cutter effect just rough shaped bricks
or blocks of chocolate I'm going to put
this on some plastic wrap and just kind
of roll it into like a log shape the
shape really not that important as
you'll see so I'm going to put this in
the fridge it's going to harden up by
the way you can just put yours in the
fridge I put mine in the freezer cuz I
was in a hurry and it actually got too
hard so while that is firming up in the
fridge the only other thing you got to
prep is a small bowl of cocoa powder to
dust these with alright by now our
chocolate is firm and ready to cut into
stones so take your chocolate take a
small knife I in fact put mine in the
freezer so it got too firm you know I
was in a hurry so you're just going to
put yours in the fridge until it's firm
enough to cut
don't worry about making it perfect as
long as you kind of have the same size
pieces you want it to be irregular you
want it to look like chiseled bricks or
blocks of stone so even though it looks
a little rough when you first cut it as
soon as you toss it in that Coco it's
going to have this just amazing
transformation into we can only be
described as hot chocolate stones find
yourself a nice decorative box to put
these in alright doesn't hurt if it has
the word love across the top and then
you present this as your gift for
Valentine's Day and she opens it and
she's like oh my god are those hot
chocolate stones those are beautiful and
the flavor profile of these just perfect
for Valentine's dark chocolate a hint of
warmth from the pepper a little shot of
salt you show your sensitive side by
making a homemade Valentine's gift but
you also show your masculinity with the
stonecutter shape because really what is
more masculine than stone shaped
chocolate pretty much nothing and when
she bites into that and you see those
